case_title: Abdul Khaliq and another vs Muhammad Ismail and others

legal_issues.possession: Respondents were found to be in physical possession of the subject land.
legal_issues.ownership_documents: Neither party had legal documents of ownership.

contract_disputes.petitioners_contract: Contract dated 02 April 2011, claimed by petitioners.
contract_disputes.respondents_contract: Contract dated 08 September 2003, claimed by respondents.

legal_issues.court_fee: Petitioners failed to meet the deficiency of court fee.

key_findings.petitioners_possession: Petitioners failed to prove possession of the subject land.
key_findings.respondents_possession: Respondents were found to be in cultivating possession of the subject land.
key_findings.clean_hands_principle: Petitioners concealed material facts and did not approach the court with clean hands.
key_findings.equitable_remedies: Petitioners were not entitled to equitable remedies under sections 42 and 54 of the Specific Relief Act, 1877.

case_law_references: Atta Muhammad v. Maula Bakhsh (2007 SCMR 1446)

summary: The petitioners failed to prove their possessory title or ownership of the subject land. The respondents were found to be in physical possession and had a favorable arbitration decision. The court upheld the findings of the subordinate courts and dismissed the revision petition.
